p: Though there are no currently occupied sites that will remain suitable in the future for upland species, there are potential refugia sites within all three of the major upland ranges of the Falkland Islands: the Hornby Mountains (West Falkland), Hill Cove Mountains (West Falkland) and Wickham Heights (East Falkland). By 2080 suitable areas are predicted for Azorella selago and Nassauvia falklandica within all three major hill ranges, whilst Acaena antarctica is only predicted to occur within the Hornby Mountains. Notably for Nassauvia falklandica, a species not currently known from East Falkland, modelling predicts suitable environmental conditions in 2080 along two sections of the major hill range on this island, Wickham Heights.
